title: Downgrade crypto libraries to support the latest version of solana client
impl pg array type for publickeybin
body:
Implement the `PgHasArrayType` trait for the `PublicKeyBinary` when the `sqlx-postgres` feature is enabled to allow saving arrays of pubkey binaries to the database. This is currently required for the persistence of the `delegate_keys` assigned to an organization in the IoT Config service to allow orgs to delegate the management of certain network features to a pre-supplied list of approved keys.

Also cleans up a lint error in one of the tests

title: Optimize Ord/PartialOrd to not use strings
body:
This changes PartialOrd and Ord for PublicKey and it’s various inner representation. This _will_ change how keys are sorted in code relying on Ord but so far we’ve not seen any

Fixes #40

title: Add PublicKeyBinary
body:
This introduces PublicKeyBinary as a convenience newtype around the bytes that represent the binary form of a PublicKey.

This avoids having to validate the public key bytes (i.e. solve curve equations)  when not needed. This is useful, for example when passing public keys in binary messages

title: Ensure secret_to_vec() returns original entropy.
body:
The recent change to the ed25519 crate caused the `keypair.secret` member to return something besides the expected original seed entropy. This created problems for callers of `secret_to_vec()` , which expected it to return just the entropy.

The fix is to change
 self.secret.to_vec() -> self.secret.seed().to_vec()

I also added unit tests in the keypair module to assert this expectation for all key types that implement secret_to_vec().

title: use ed25519-compact
body: This switches to use ed25519-compact instead of dalek since it’s more stable and supported by the libsodium authors.

title: secp256k1 support
body: A few todos and hacks remain, but rebased on master and tests are passing.

title: Add unit tests for serializing and deserializing PublicKey
Bump p256 crate
body:
Updated p256 to the latest version (0.11.X). Made appropriate changes
using latest p256 api.

title: TPM persistent key support
body:
Add support for persistent TPM keys.
TPM keys can be stored both on external storage (on filesystem) or inside TPM chip. Depending on storage place it requires different ways to unpack\deserealize it.

title: Cleanup TPM code
body: This PR contains what _should be_ cosmetic and safety improvements for the TPM feature.

title: Lint all features
body:
This PR has pre-requisite work for merging and testing #24:

- apt-install TSS2 libraries on the runner for trusted platform module support
- run the linter  (`cargo clippy`) with all features enabled

title: Custom Debug for PublicKey
Truncate input when constructing keypairs from bytes
body:
The upstream crypto crates return `Err` when the input slice is not exactly what they expect. This is a problem when the input had unrelated trailing data. 

A reasonable argument could be made to require consumers of this crate to right-size the input slice before calling `Keypair::try_from`, but that requires knowledge about the crypto crates two dependencies deep.

title: impl Hash for PublicKey
body: It's useful to be able to use PublicKey as a key for HashMap and this enables that. Rust doesn't like it when you derive PartialEq but then implement Hash by hand, thus PartialEq is also derived.

title: Expose ecc608-linux types out of ecc608
body: This exposes ecc608-linux types out of the the helium_crypto:ecc608 module to avoid duplicate dependencies.

title: Allow public keys of variable length by type
body: To allow for other keytypes the fixed public key bytesize is no longer viable. This introduces a PublicKeySize trait which implementations can use to indicate their binary size

title: Add ecc608 support as a feature
adds default impl to Network and KeyType
body: Adds default impl for KeyType and Network. This is needed for some refactoring I am doing to helium-wallet-rs to make it much easier to use as a crate in other wallet projects.

title: exopse a full Keypair
body: Adds a full Keypair enum that can represent both ecc_compact and ed25519 keypairs

title: Now using the new compact traits feature
Add from_bytes for Signature types
body: ALso fixes compact construction for ecc_compact keys

title: Allow ecc_compact construction from a non-compact/compressed key
body: Returns an error if the bytes generate a key that is not compactable

title: Adds serde Deserializer support for PublicKey
Fixes ecc_compact:Keypair
body: Fix up ecc_compact Keypair to avoid a clone on every sign instruction

title: Fix ed25519::generate_from_entropy
body: The implementationw was erroneously trying to create a keypair from the given entropy instead of just the secret key.

title: Add minimum length checking for keytypes
body: Handles index 0 panics for keytype/tag parsing

title: Adds keypair from/into_bytes implementation
body: This  does _not_ implement the higher level keypair independent encoding used by the wallet
